name: Pavillon de la Torse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like all the other reviewers, we too found Pavillon de la Torse to be truly excellent in all ways: great room, large and comfortable bed, fine breakfast and afternoon apertifs, plus the congenial and helpful hosts, Marie and Francois, who answered email queries about other destinations even before we got there, and worked over maps with us while we were there. This is a fabulous place.
reviews.title: Best B&B You Will Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bill
reviews.title: Wonderful place in Aix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three memorable days and nights with Marie and Francois and enjoyed every moment there. The house and grounds are excellent, surpassed only by the incomparable hospitality shown by our hosts. We regretted our stay was so brief - and intend to have a longer stay next time. Each day we looked forward to the lively conversation over the late afternoon drinks on the terrace. Everybody made a point of getting together then and enjoyed each other's company. Marie and Francois took every effort to make all of us feel at home and provided practical advice about restaurants and places to visit. We also greatly appreciated the free use of their internet and laundry facilities. These were unexpected bonuses that added to our enjoyment and comfort at Pavillon de la Torse. We have no hesitation in recommending Pavillon de la Torse to anybody.
reviews.title: Charm, wonderful hosts, great location, Provence... What more could you want?

likes.liked: — The entire package. It is a winner!

If you are looking for somewhere unique and relaxing to stay with thoughtful and interesting hosts then this is the place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking for a base from which to explore the Southern Vaucluse as well as the coastal area around Marseille, we chose the Pavillon de la Torse and were not disappointed. Ideally situated within walking distance of the many cafes and restaurants in Aix yet less than 5 mins from the autoroute, the Pavillon has rightly been described as an oasis.
reviews.title: A Special Place
A real find!
reviews.text: Marie and Francois were ideal hosts, not intrusive but readily available for advice and guidance. No, we didn't have cheese for breakfast either, like all the other hotels.....but isn't that the point ? The Pavillon de la Torse is a special place,thankfully not like all the other hotels but one to which we shall return before too long.

Marie and Francois have developed this delightful building and grounds into a first class B&B. Friendly and welcoming, with excellent, varied breakfasts and an enjoyable aperitif session before you set off to find an evening meal (or do your own thing in the pool house). It may be a 15/20 minute walk from Aix centre but worth every step! Your peace is assured (apart from a few owl hoots).
reviews.title: cash only

reviews.text: Clean and spacious. Decor is adequate, a New Orleans inspired bedroom theme than a true Provence experience. Breakfast adequate, ample supply of croissants, limited fruit offering and no cheese as served routinely everywhere else. Beautiful garden with "do not walk" signs placed in lawns surrounding swimmingpool. Expensive comparatively.
reviews.title: Don't forget your swimsuit! The pool is gorgeous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the most wonderful time here at the end of our 2 weeks in the South of France. Having already stayed in some absolute gems, Pavillon de la Torse managed to pip them all to the top. Everything from the warm welcome, to the evening drinks, to the beautiful surroundings and pool were divine. Marie and Francois were the perfect, generous hosts and recommended some fabulous restaurants which helped us make an informed choice in Aix where there are over 500 to choose from.
reviews.title: Paradise!
A wonderful stay
reviews.text: Make this your first choice if staying in Aix. In fact, make this your reason to come to Aix!

We spent a fantastic 2 days at Marie and Francois' wonderful home in a spectacular setting. Very close to the centre of Aix ~(less than 20 mins walk) but far enough away to make it a peaceful setting. Room was lovely, pool elegant and hospitality excellent.
reviews.title: The Best B&B ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in B&B's for many years and are comfortable saying that Pavillon de la Torse is far and away the best we have ever encountered, bar none. From the minute we were welcomed by our hosts, Marie and Francois Gregoire, we were made to feel that this was to be our home, not just a place to visit. Most websites tend to overstate their features or omit things they don't want you to know. In this case, Marie and Francois have very modestly understated the beauty of this home, the fluffy linens, the individually decorated rooms, the comfortable library, the amazing park-like setting, the wonderful breakfast service, and on and on. Guests should not miss the 6:30 cocktail hour. This isn't just drinks and snacks, this is a hosted gathering of guests giving one an opportunity to meet interesting people from around the world and just visit in a delightful settting. We were interested to find that the conversations from the night before would frequently pick up again over breakfast. The hosts offer free internet service and free worldwide telephone service via VOIP. This is clearly a "first" in our experience. Another "first" is the use of the laundry facilities on the property. Included in our welcome package was a list of recommended restaurants in the area. We tried several and weren't disappointed. Marie and Francois are also very happy to suggest short day trips outside of Aix, and as with the restaurant recommendations, they didn't disappoint. The property has a magnificent swimming pool and sunbathing area and also backs on to a large public park which is convenient for walking or jogging. As we drove away, we felt that we had just spent a week with friends in their lovely home. We selected this property because we wanted a nice place to stay while we visited Provence for the first time. Ironically, the place itself became the real focus of our visit! We highly recommend a stay.
reviews.title: Lived up to its reputation

likes.liked: — Friendliness of hosts, location, and the property itself

reviews.title: Relax at Pavillon
reviews.text: It's been almost 3 weeks since we have returned to NYC and hardly a day goes by that we don't think about our fantastic stay at Pavilion de la Torse. We stayed 3 nights at the end of August and we enjoyed our stay as much if not more than those who posted comments on TripAdvisor (which is the reason why we chose the place, all the reviews were equally consistent). Francoise and Marie are every bit as fabulous as people say they are on this website. I don't want to be redundant and repeat all the great things that are said about this place by other reviewers (but I could as everything that I've read is true here), so the few things I will add are:

We stayed at Pavillon de la Torse for 2 nights in August. What a wonderful experience for first-timers like us in Provence! The house has been beautifully restored and the photos probably do not do it justice. The trees are just magnificent and this is truly an oasis in a fairly big town. Everything was walking distance and easy to get to.
reviews.title: Like coming home

reviews.text: Marie and Francois are a lovely couple who go out of their way to make you feel at home. They offer aperitifs every evening at 6.30pm - something I have not experienced at other B&Bs. You really feel as if you are talking to friends and it was quite difficult to tear ourselves away to go for dinner! They gave us such useful recommendations for restaurants and places to see - some of the smaller villages we would never have visited otherwise and it was definitely worthwhile.
reviews.title: A Cézanne come to life

reviews.text: I cannot recommend this B&B enough - will definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Retire to the South of France

reviews.title: Perfection

aka: Pavillon De La Torse Hotel Aix-En-Provence
description: Award-winning accommodation. 18th-century bastide entirely remodeled. 5 comfortable rooms with private baths, 2.5 acres of spectacular gardens with giant plane trees and fountains, 25m infinity pool, large parking, free internet WiFi in every room, non-smoking environment, 15 min walk to downtown Aix en Provence - Bus line #3 at the gate, Easy access to A8 & A51 freeways. Blends country tranquility and the charm of the city.
